summary: Angkor Wat is a huge temple complex in Cambodia, recognized by Guinness World Records as the largest religious structure globally. Initially a Hindu temple built in the 12th century for King Suryavarman II, it later became a Buddhist temple. The complex, designed to resemble Mount Meru, spans over 400 acres and features a moat, three galleries, and five towers at its center. Angkor Wat is a significant tourist attraction, drawing over 2.5 million visitors annually, and is a symbol of Cambodia, featured on its national flag. It was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1992.
title: Angkor Wat
